title: Lamprecht/Chapman Custodian
description: Carpet cleaning and custodial work around campus including restrooms and offices, operation of heavy and sometimes awkward equipment, walking and pushing carts, carrying supplies and tools, lifting up to 50 pounds is regularly required, working with chemicals, lifting hands above head, kneeling, walking, standing for 3 hour shift. Other assignments as requested.
summary: Shift is 7:00pm to 10:00pm Monday-Friday approximately 15 hours weekly.

title: PM140 OnlineTutor
description:
The position requires to be trained as a tutor, use I-Plan to help students in the class setup tutoring appointments, and tutor students who are struggling in the class.

Please upload a copy of your unofficial transcript with application,

Directions for downloading unofficial student transcripts

 

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.
summary: A tutor is needed for the PM 140 (PMPC 140) class. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. The tutor will use I-plan to set up hours of availability for students who need a tutor for the class. Hours worked is dependent on student demand for tutor help.For more information please contact the Online TA/Tutoring Office at 208-496-1595 or onlineta@byui.edu.
approximateHoursPerWeek: 5-10 hours (must post 7 hours of appt openings and work 3+ hours on tutorin
workSchedule: Hours worked may vary according to student demand

title: ACCTG180 OnlineTutor
description:
Online Tutor is needed for the ACCTG 180: Survey of Accounting. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning). 

 Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595. 

Please up-load your unofficial transcript to this application by following the steps below:

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.

title: Chat Specialist
description:
As a BYU-Idaho Customer Care Specialist, you will be working in a professional atmosphere, representing the University and upholding its standards. Your duties will include working in a fast pace environment to accurately and professionally resolve incoming questions and issues about BYU-Idaho and BYU-Idaho services. You will oversee and improve the University ChatBot, approve class authorizations and work on additional projects.

You will also be responsible for offering an excellent customer service experience. Employees will be held accountable for the service extended to customers and for maintaining a business professional mindset. Over time, exemplary performance will provide a variety of opportunities for growth and responsibility.

We are looking for students who:

  • Exhibit clear communication skills
  • Enjoy talking to and are motivated to help resolve issues
  • Adapt well to change
  • Are receptive to constructive feedback
  • Possess creative problem-solving skills
  • Have proficient typing skills (at least 40 WPM)

This position is a Monday-Friday commitment, 15-20 hours/week minimum. Extra shifts may be available for those who are interested in more hours. Agents must work the shift they are assigned 5 days of the week, no adjustments or exceptions can be made to the shifts hours. Available shifts may include

*See Available shifts below

During busy periods agents may be required to pick up extra shifts to assist with the volume. Agents may be required to work through breaks in between a semester.

This position requires attendance at a one week in-person training. The training will be in person and times will be arranged after you are hired.
summary: Your duties include working at a fast pace to accurately and professionally resolve incoming questions/issues about BYUI and BYUI services. You are responsible for offering an excellent customer service experience and are held accountable for the service extended to customers while maintaining a professional mindset.

title: Online Tutor - AGBPC 105 (Pathway)
description:
Online Tutor is needed for AGBPC 105: Entrepreneurship in Agribusiness (Pathway course) online. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Hours are flexible, but you need to set up 10 hours of availability per week. The position requires you to be trained as a tutor, use I-Plan to help students in the class setup tutoring appointments, and tutor students who are struggling in the class. Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah.

For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at 208-496-1595 or oas.employment@byui.edu. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process.

Please upload a copy of your unofficial transcript with application.

Directions for downloading unofficial student transcripts:

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "PDF unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or USB drive.

description: Caring for campus grounds and plants, weeding, raking, shoveling, lifting up to 50 pounds, sod replacement, mowing, and other jobs as requested by the supervisor. Once snow falls, the position will become on-call.
summary: Caring for the grounds on campus in areas assigned. Must be able to work a consistent 3-4 hours block between 6:00AM and 2:30PM Monday through Friday. Once snow falls, the position will become on-call.

For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at 208-496-1595 or oas.employment@byui.edu.

Please upload a copy of your unofficial transcript with your application,

Directions for downloading unofficial student transcripts

 1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.

title: BIO264 OnlineTA
description:
This course uses a "pooled TA" model. The TAs hired for this course are to be spread throughout the week to be available to help with the "Teaching Ticket" assignment. IT will be the TAs job to run Teach One Another sessions and check off that students understand their assignment. TAs will also reach out to specific "at risk" student groups as directed by an assigned BIO 264 instructor. 10 hours per week.

The job hours are flexible to the position. You must be living in Idaho or Utah

Facilitate review sessions, grade exams, attend weekly on campus training, and tutor students.

description:
To be qualified for the position, you must have taken the course and received a B or better. The job hours are flexible as this is an online position. You must be living in Idaho or Utah.

TAs work in instructional teams. Timely completion of assigned work is crucial to success. TA's needs to be self-disciplined by being committed and consistent in working everyday to make sure all tasks are done on time and offer 1:1 support.

For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at 208-496-1595 or oas.employment@byui.edu.

Please include a copy of your unofficial transcripts.

Directions for downloading unofficial student transcripts

 1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.

title: PUBH240 OnlineTA
description:
Teaching Assistants are needed for the PUBH 240: Intro to Public Health class. Applicants must have passed the course with an A- or better, have good interpersonal skills (cultural awareness), and exceptional English Writing and reading skills.  Teaching Assistants are needed to do the following in the class:
• Grade the Preparation Assignments based on the rubrics provided in the course
• Notify instructor of incomplete or substandard student work for the instructor to address
• Regrade Preparation Assignment resubmissions upon approval
• Grade the weekly discussion boards (current event and job-of-the-week posts).
Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. TAs work in instructional teams. Timely completion of assigned work is crucial to success. TA's needs to be self-disciplined by being committed and consistent in working everyday to make sure all tasks are done on time.
For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

description:
A Teaching Assistant is needed for ED 361: Principles of Teaching and Assessment. To qualify for this position you must have taken the class with an A- or better.  You will also need to have a minimal understanding of Google Account functions, and Proctorial installation procedures. You must be living in Idaho or Utah.

TA's primary roles will be:
-- grading worksheets from a rubric.
-- answering students' questions
-- helping students with installations (Proctorio, Google Account, Zoom) at the beginning of the semester)

title: BUS410 OnlineTA
description:
A Teaching Assistant is needed for BUS 410 online. This class was formerly known as B 483. To qualify for the position, you must be a business major and have a GPA of 3.5 or higher. The position would require around  3-5 hrs per section for a proposed 3 sections of work per week. The job hours are flexible to the position. You must be living in Idaho or Utah. This course has a heavy grading and group management load. TAs are needed in this course to reduce instructor load and facilitate deeper learning. TA Weekly duties: 1) Review the group meeting evaluations 2. Provide grade entry for the Pre-Discussion Polls for each case. 3) Provide grade entry for all other post-discussion Polls.

title: BUS410 OnlineTA
description:
A Teaching Assistant is needed for BUS 410 online. This class was formerly known as B 483. To qualify for the position, you must be a business major and have a GPA of 3.5 or higher. The position would require around  3-5 hrs per section for a proposed 3 sections of work per week. The job hours are flexible to the position. You must be living in Idaho or Utah. This course has a heavy grading and group management load. TAs are needed in this course to reduce instructor load and facilitate deeper learning. TA Weekly duties: 1) Review the group meeting evaluations 2. Provide grade entry for the Pre-Discussion Polls for each case. 3) Provide grade entry for all other post-discussion Polls.

Directions for downloading unofficial student transcripts

 

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.
summary:
BIO 180 needs a Teaching Assistant for the class- department picks must be living in Idaho or Utah. The TA will provide labs to help students with their questions and problems. Monitor a "Help Central" discussion board to provide basic answers to posted questions, and conduct several "labs" or "review sessions (before an exam) weekly to work through questions posted on the Help Central discussion board and answer additional questions of those who attend.

For more information please contact the
approximateHoursPerWeek: up to 10

title: Library Aide-DCAM
description:
Student employee works with various computer software and flat bed scanners.

He/She will work with fragile materials from Special Collections and Archives for scanning these materials, then editing and preparing the digital images and documents for upload to our online database.
summary: Work in DCAM for the McKay Library, creating digital copies of original materials such as papers, photographs, books, microfilm, and newspapers.

title: Grounds Crew 16
description:
Must be on time for shifts. Work well with others. Be able to follow instruction. Ask questions if you do not fully understand. Communication is key. Knowledge of local plant material and grounds maintenance is appreciated but not required.  
Outside work with trees and shrubs. Working at heights is required. Must be okay working in tree canopies. Must be able to lift 50+ pounds.

Working at heights outside, installing and maintaining shrubs and trees

Applicant must:

  • Be on time
  • Be Punctual
  • Be able/willing to communicate openly
  • Attention to detail
  • Drivers license required 
  • Safety minded
  • Must be able to lift 50+ lbs
  • Be trainable
  • Have a great attitude
  • Experience working with ropes is a plus
summary:
Working in small groups to help keep the trees and shrubs healthy and beautiful all around campus. Two shifts available M-F 6:30-10:30 and M-F 11-3, off for devotional.  Job open through end of spring semester. 
  
Outside work with trees and shrubs. Working at heights is required. Must be okay working in tree canopies. Experience working with ropes is a plus but not required. Driver's license is required. Must be able to lift 50+ pounds.

title: BCTR  Early Morning Custodian
description: Carpet cleaning and custodial work around campus including restrooms and offices, operation of heavy and sometimes awkward equipment, walking and pushing carts, carrying supplies and tools, lifting up to 50 pounds is regularly required, working with chemicals, lifting hands above head, kneeling, walking, standing for 3 hour shift. Other assignments as requested.
summary: Cleaning campus buildings. Shift is 4:30 am-7:30 am Monday-Friday and some Saturdays as required by the building assigned, approximately 15 hours weekly.

title: Data Entry - Alumni
description:
Please read this posting thoroughly and carefully.  Please only apply if you are a Freshman or Sophomore student.  Responsibilities in this job will be tedious and repetitive.  When at work, you spend at least 95% of your time doing research and updating in the computer.  Must be able to handle constructive criticism and have common sense.  We are looking for people with longevity.  No prior data entry experience is required, you will be trained. Must be available Thursdays from 11:30-12:30 p.m. for mandatory meeting.  If hired, MUST work Fall and Winter semesters.  We strongly recommend being willing to work year-round. 

Requirements: Able to pay attention to detail, dependable, able to work alone, self-motivated, teachable, organized, and able to multi-task.  A good attitude is vital in order to be successful in this job, as well as being pleasant and helpful.  The training process requires patience and willingness to learn. 

Resumes accepted until Monday, Sept 5, 2022, at midnight.  Interviews will be held in person Friday, Sept 9, 2022.  NO EXCEPTIONS.  You will be contacted by phone after Sept 6 or 7, if granted an interview.  A typing test will be given at the interview.  If you are not chosen for an interview, you will receive an email on or before Sept 8.  No phone calls or in person visits, please.
summary: This position enters data into the Alumni database.  We keep track of address, phone, email, job, and company information, etc. for those who have graduated.  Responsibilities in this job are tedious and repetitive.  You do not need prior data entry experience to apply for this job.  When at work, you spend at least 95% of your time doing research and updating in the computer.  A good attitude, willingness to work and be trained is a must.  Longevity is required if hired for this position.

Other assignments as requested.
summary: Cleaning campus buildings. Shift is 4am-7am Monday-Friday and some Saturdays as required by the building assigned, approximately 15 hours weekly.

title: Carpet Cleaning Crew
description: Carpet cleaning and custodial work around campus including restrooms and offices, operation of heavy and awkward equipment, walking and pushing carts, carrying supplies and tools, lifting up to 80 pounds is regularly required, working with chemicals, lifting hands above head, kneeling, walking, standing during full hour shift. Other assignments as requested.
summary: Cleaning carpets throughout the university buildings from 9pm-Midnight,  Monday-Friday.

title: CSE272 OnlineTutor
description:
Online Tutor is needed for CS 432 (CSE 272): Software Lifecycle Models. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning).  

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

title: University Aid Processing Specialist
description:
Duties: Analyze awarding data, determine award amounts, confirm that students meet university aid requirements, and ensure that awards are processed accurately and in a timely manner.  This individual will also be involved in forecasting, determining award criteria, and reaching out to inform others about available university aid options; this includes answering questions that come through a variety of sources (emails, phone calls, financial aid counselors, etc.), strengthening relationships with campus departments and keeping them informed of university aid updates. Ensuring that all university aid procedures are documented and updated.

Skills/Experience:  Applicants should be able to work well on a team; they must have an eye for detail and be able to work independently with minimal supervision.  The individual must have a thorough knowledge of Microsoft Office components, especially Microsoft Excel.  We are looking for someone creative who has the ability to see the vision of where we would like to go and is not afraid to suggest improvements to current processes in order to reach the end goal.
summary: Ensures that all university aid is processed successfully
workSchedule: Somewhat flexible. Minimum 20 hours per week.

title: Grounds Crew 3
description: Caring for campus grounds and plants, weeding, raking, shoveling, mowing, edging, lifting up to 50 pounds, sod replacement, snow removal during winter, other jobs as requested by the supervisor.  MUST HAVE A CURRENT DRIVERS LICENSE.
summary: Hiring for the Fall Semester. Shift is from 6:30 AM to 10:30 AM or 10:30 AM to 2:30 PM, Monday through Friday. Caring for campus grounds and plants, weeding, raking, shoveling, mowing, edging, lifting up to 50 pounds, sod replacement, snow removal during winter, other jobs as requested by the supervisor.  MUST HAVE A CURRENT DRIVERS LICENSE.

Other assignments as requested.
summary: Hiring 4am-7am Monday-Friday and some Saturdays as required by the building assigned, approximately 15 hours weekly.

title: Food Services Student Jobs
description:
Fast-paced, demanding job.  We need dependable, hard-working, and punctual people. Set times for positions. Must be willing to learn and take on more responsibilities as the job requires.

AVAILABLE SHIFTS

Crossroads Backroom 5:35 am - 9:25 am

Promotions are available based on performance.
summary: Fall Food Service Jobs Start at $10 PER HOUR and $3 DISCOUNT ON FOOD each day you work. We are looking for dynamic individuals who know how to work hard and can adapt to change in a fast-paced environment. Must be able to stand for long periods and lift up to 50 lbs. Learn and take on more responsibilities as we go through semester.

title: Systems & Innovation: Technology Specialist
description:
Responsibilities

  • Trouble-shoot issues within the Canvas LMS and other platforms

  • Resolve issues within a timely manner

  • Communicate professionally via email, Zoom, or in-person with administrators/instructors

  • Integrate 3rd party educational technologies with the LMS

Desired Skills (helpful, not required)

  • I-Learn (TA or other experience)

  • Communication

  • Web applications

  • Detail-oriented

  • Public speaking

  • Professionalism

We ask that you submit a resume and cover letter as part of the application process. You will also need to go through a technology skill test, which will be scheduled if you are selected to move forward. We provide on-the-job training and professional development as part of employment with the Systems and Innovation Team with Online Learning. The position requires at least 12 hours a week, but we provide flexible scheduling options to accommodate various school schedules.
summary: As a Technology Specialist, you will be expected to complete tickets regarding the Canvas LMS and other educational technology platforms. You will counsel with the Product Specialists to ensure issues are resolved efficiently. This position will require professional interactions with University administrators to discuss issues in their courses or with corresponding platforms.
workSchedule: Monday-Saturday (7 AM to 10 PM, flexible shifts)

title: Degree Verification Mid Shift
description:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Reviewing students to determine if they have qualified for graduation.
  • Awarding degrees and certificates to students who meet requirements, processing diplomas for those who have graduated.
  • Providing customer service to students, parents of students, faculty, staff, and administrators via email, phone, and walk-ins.

The ideal candidate must be able to commit to an 11am to 3pm, Monday to Friday schedule.

The ideal candidate must have demonstrated proficiency in the following: adaptability, , meeting deadlines, troubleshooting skills, problem solving, and analyzing abilities.
summary:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Reviewing students to determine if they have qualified for graduation.
Awarding degrees and certificates to students who meet requirements, processing diplomas for those who have graduated.
Providing customer service to students, parents of students, faculty, staff, and administrators via email, phone, and walk-ins.

The ideal candidate must be able to commit to an 11am to 3pm, Monday to Friday schedule.

title: Welding Lab Helper
description:
Need worker to handle and prepare materials for use in the Welding Lab.

  • Expected hours: 10-20 per week (depending upon semester).
  • Worker will use potentially dangerous equipment to cut metal (industrial experience preferred).
  • Worker will be required to stand, kneel, bend, and lift heavy loads regularly.

title: Recording/Post Audio Engineering Student
description:
Work may include recording and mixing devotionals, Center Stage events, and various events on campus. Students record location audio for various campus-wide videos, work on post production audio in addition to clerical and studio maintenance work. - Fillout http://bit.ly/BYUIPAGoogleHire . After you have finished filling out that form please come back and apply officially for the job on this BYUI Student Job Board.

Additional duties include maintaining calendars, working on updating spreadsheets, licensing software, maintaining audio computers and equipment etc.

If more than a week has gone by since you posted feel free to reach out to olsona@byui.edu about the status of your application.
summary: I-Center A/V & Broadcast Productions - Production Audio

title: Grounds Crew 13
description:
Hours: 3-4 consecutive hours Monday-Friday, between 9am-3pm. When snow falls, guaranteed hours go away and it will become an on-call position, which will include weekends when snowing.

Start date: would like for you to start on September 9th, but not mandatory.

Fall Clean-Up:

*This job is landscape maintenance; lawn mowing, edging, whipping, blowing, weeding, tree rinks, bark replacement, and cleanup.

*Needs to be able to lift 50 lbs on their own and up to 150 lbs with someone else.

*Needs to be hardworking and responsible.

*Landscape repair

*Construction cleanup

*15-20 hours a week

Snow Removal:

* This position does not guarantee a certain number of hours each week, hours depend on snowfall. You will be On-Call Monday through Sunday.

*Must have warm snow clothes, you will be working in extremely cold conditions. Work gloves will be required.

*Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

*Physically capable of performing repetitive labor tasks and lifting and/or handling 50 lbs. or more consistently and safely.
summary:
General landscape maintenance until snow falls. General landscape includes lawn mowing, edging, whipping, blowing, weeding, tree rinks, bark replacement, and cleanup. As weather changes, work will transition into on-call snow removal. On-call snow removal hours are on an as-needed basis. 

A driver's license is appreciated but not required.

title: Taylor Early Morning Custodian
description: Carpet cleaning and custodial work around campus including restrooms and offices, operation of heavy and sometimes awkward equipment, walking and pushing carts, carrying supplies and tools, lifting up to 50 pounds is regularly required, working with chemicals, lifting hands above head, kneeling, walking, standing for 3 hour shift. summary: Cleaning campus buildings. Shift is 4:30am-7:30am Monday-Friday and some Saturdays as required by the building assigned, approximately 15 hours weekly.

title: Testing Center Proctor
description:
This application is regarding the Fall 2022 Semester.

While an individual shift may vary at times, these are the typical expectations of a shift:

Proctoring:

  • Proctor students as they take their online and paper/pencil exams in the Testing Center
  • Proctor 4 areas in 15-minute increments over the period of an hour.
  • Confidently address sensitive matters, such as integrity reports and other Honor Code violations;
  • Must be physically capable of standing for extensive periods of time
  • Input passwords for computer exams

Handling Exams:

  • Administer online and paper/pencil exams to students in a professional manner
  • Accurately file exams in alphabetic and numerical order
  • Employee will learn computer programs (TARS/Akindi/Proctorio)

Your application MUST include A VIDEO introduction about yourself.

Please follow the steps below...

- Go to https://streamable.com/ and upload your video. If you use your phone, you can record your video directly from their site.

- Please email tcassistantsbyui@gmail.com with a link to your video.

- 2-3 Minutes long

  • Please include the following information about yourself:
  • Your full name
  • Your major
  • What your track is 
  • When you graduate
  • Why you stand out among our applicants
  • What shift(s) would you be able to work
  • How many hours would you want
  • Include any other information you want us to know about you. 

Shift's that we are looking to fill: 

Mon/Wed/Fri 10:00 AM-12:30 PM

Tue/Th/Sat 12:30-3:30 PM

- Shifts are linked by Mon/Wed/Fri OR Tues/Thurs/Sat
(ex. If you work Monday, you also work the same time on Wednesday and Friday)

Required  to be Considered for Position:

  • Resume 

  • Fall 2022 class schedule

  • 2 years (or more) of school remaining

  • Willingness to work during finals/ before holidays

  • English proficiency

  • Academic standing/ high level of integrity

  • Good work ethic (arrives on time, respects superiors, accepts correction)

  • Demonstrate attention to detail

  • Must follow FERPA policies/ Honor Code/ Dress and Grooming.
summary: This position would be regarding Fall 2022 Semester. As a BYU-I Testing Center proctor, you would be expected to administer exams, proctor students in person/online, file exams and learn Testing Center software.
approximateHoursPerWeek: 8-20 per week

title: Stores and Receiving Delivery Driver
description:
The starting pay rate for this position is $11.58 per hour.

The driver position helps sort incoming freight shipments and then delivers these packages to a variety of locations on campus.  Also assists with a wide variety of tasks in our warehouse. The available shift is 8am - 12pm  M-F.  We are looking for someone that could start immediately and work through Fall Semester 2022.

We plan to fill these positions immediately.

Please do not apply if you cannot work the posted shift hours.
summary: This position will drive a delivery truck and deliver a variety of packages and other merchandise to various offices throughout the BYU-Idaho campus.

title: Chemistry Lab Director
description: This position is responsible for the organization and success of the Chemistry Drop-In Lab. This person must have great leadership abilities, effective communication skills, and excellent organizational abilities.  Must have done well in higher level Chemistry courses.
summary: This position is responsible for the organization and success of the Chemistry Drop-In Lab. This person must have great leadership abilities, effective communication skills, and excellent organizational abilities.  Must have done well in higher level Chemistry courses.

title: MC Day Custodian
description:
Job includes: cleaning restrooms, basic cleaning (dusting, wiping tables/chairs, sweeping, mopping, etc.), helping with event setup/take down, and other responsibilities as directed by supervisor.

Please be aware that the physical requirements of this job include:

  • Carpet cleaning
  • Custodial work including the cleaning of restrooms and offices
  • Operation of heavy and sometimes awkward equipment
  • Walking and pushing carts
  • Carrying supplies and tools
  • The ability to lift up to 50 pounds required
  • Working with chemicals
  • Lifting hands above head, kneeling, walking, and standing for a 4 hour shift
  • And other assignments as requested
summary:
Shift is 11:30AM- 2:30PM, Monday through Friday, and some Saturdays.
THIS SCHEDULE IS FIRM. Job includes: cleaning restrooms, basic cleaning (dusting, wiping tables/chairs, sweeping, mopping, etc.), helping with event setup/take down, and other responsibilities as directed by supervisor.

title: Executive Office Student Writer
description:
Job Description:

Writing and Editing

  • Write high-profile, professional letters, other correspondence, and communication.
  • Proofread correspondence, reports, minutes of meetings, manuscripts, speeches, etc., often relating to confidential and sensitive matters.

Scheduling and Administrative Support

  • Perform office tasks such as scanning, placing and receiving calls, photocopying, mailing, entering data, organizing information, and running errands.

Knowledge, Skills, and Experience:

Education and Experience:

  • Previous writing/editing experience needed
  • English or Communication major preferred

Skill Set:

  • Expertise in English and grammar rules
  • Exceptional organizational, writing, grammar, and editing skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint)

Core Competencies:

  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Comfortable with high levels of confidentiality
  • Be able to balance and prioritize diverse projects
  • Responsible, reliable, and accountable
  • Institutional knowledge of BYU-Idaho

Position Details:

Schedule:

  • INTERNSHIP AVAILABLE for English and Communications majors
  • Available to begin training by August 2022. Regular hours to begin September 2022.
  • Approximate hours a week for internship: 30-40
  • Approximate hours a week for part-time: 20

Other:

  • Follow all BYU-Idaho Dress and Grooming Standards.
  • Business professional attire is required.
summary: The Executive Office Student Writer must have expertise in English and grammar. This position serves as a support role to the Office of the President and the Executive Office. The incumbent is expected to keep up with the general flow of the Executive Office and maintain professional communication during interactions with university leadership, church officers, executives, and students.
approximateHoursPerWeek: 20-40 hours

title: Health Center Lab Assistant
description:
PRINCIPLE DUTIES

  • Phlebotomy: Retrieve information regarding which test needs to be performed, enter patient data correctly, and draw blood.
  • Tests: Perform streptococcus, mononucleosis, urinalysis, tuberculosis, and other in-house tests.
  • Stocking: Manage inventory by restocking lab supplies from storage as needed.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Education and Work Experience: 3 months of phlebotomy experience or equivalent preferred.
  • Skill Set: Ability to think critically, communicate clearly, multitask, keep organized, manage time wisely, behave professionally, practice hospitality, accept direction from others, provide responsible leadership, take initiative to complete tasks, remain self-motivated, work quickly and accurately under pressure, and work well in groups. Basic understanding and working knowledge of computers. This lab position offers an opportunity to work in a CLIA certified laboratory and learn all aspects of a clinical laboratory.  Laboratory management opportunities and internships are available.
  • License or Certification: Phlebotomy certificate, or other certification such as MA, CMA, RN, CLA, etc. Previous phlebotomy experience required. Must provide a physical copy of high school transcript.

APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

  • Please do not apply through this website. Email your resume, cover letter, graduation date, and class schedule to HealthCenterLabManager@byui.edu

IMPORTANT: All employees of the Student Health Center are required to receive or have record of the following immunizations: 
     TB (must be updated annually)
     FLU (must be current for this season)
     TDAP (must be updated every 10 years)
     MMR (2 doses)
     VARICELLA (Chicken pox - 2 doses)
     HEPATITIS B (3 doses)

NOTE: The Student Health Center can administer most immunizations as necessary. All student employees are financially responsible for completing this requirement. You will be requested to provide records during general training. The SHC must have record of the above immunizations before on-the-job training begins.
summary: Assist lab manager in phlebotomy, performance of tests, and organization of lab. Strengthen connection between lab and health care providers by ensuring that tests are completed in a timely manner and all lab results are reported accurately. This position is for an experienced phlebotomist with a certificate in phlebotomy, medical assisting, or ENT.

title: A/V & Broadcast Productions Lighting Crew
description:
We are looking for students seeking practical experience while helping our team achieve our goals and objectives.  We need several students with different experience in a number of areas (explained below).

All students must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must be responsible, self-motivated, self-starter, personable, teachable and well organized. 
  • Superior customer service skills to deal with both internal and external customers.
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. 
  • Must be able to effectively handle stressful situations.
  • Must be able lift at least 50 lbs.
  • Ability to work comfortably at heights.
  • Minimum of two semesters of school left
  • Ability to work nights and weekends.
  • Be able to creatively interpret ideas as well as follow directions.

Students must have experience in at least three (or more) of the following areas:

  • Ability to use and understand various kinds of test equipment, tools, and meters such as volt, ohm, and amp meters.
  • Basic understanding of electrical principles, formulas, drawings and stage lighting plots.
  • Previous experience of controlling and operating conventional and moving light consoles. 
  • Ability to hang, and focus theatrical lighting fixtures.
  • Experience using a follow spot
  • Interest and experience in entertainment production.
  • Experience Operating Scissor Lifts, Forklifts, boom lifts, etc.
  • Experience with stage rigging installation, maintenance, and operation.
  • Experience with computer network troubleshooting. 
  • Experience with electronics repair.

title: Remote Proctor
description:
Interact with Various Stakeholders of the Testing Center

(a) communicate effectively with faculty members at BYU-Idaho and students via telephone and email as well as face-to-face.

(b) demonstrate professionalism in all these communications.

Review and Act as Exam Proctor

(a) Review reports from primary proctors

(b) Perform secondary reviews as necessary

Generate Remote Proctoring Reports and Manage Workload

(a) Use specific tools and Excel/Google Sheets to generate exam reports.

(b) Coordinate and assign proctoring workload.

Provide Remote Proctoring Support to Students and Faculty

(a) Train faculty and proctors, when necessary, on the use of Proctorio from an admin point of view.

(b) Advise students of proper use of Proctorio when necessary.

Our Schedule is 8:00am - 5:00pm Monday - Friday

Preferred Attributes:

- Have at least 2 years of school left

- Willingness to work during and after finals

- English Proficiency

Required Skills:

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills

- Team mindset and "Customer Service" attitude

- Strong social skills to interact with others effectively

- Ability to troubleshoot basic technical problems

- MS Office

Desired Skills:

- MS Excel / Google Sheets

- MS Outlook

***To be considered for this position, your application will need to include a video introduction about yourself. Please follow the steps below.***

1. Create a 2-3 minute video of yourself with the following information:

  • Your full name
  • Why you are applying for this position
  • Why we should hire you out of all other applicants
  • What hours in the day you would be available to work (i.e. 8-11, 12-5, etc.)
  • When you expect to graduate
  • Anything else you'd like us to know about you

2. Go to https://streamable.com/ and upload your video. If you use your phone, you can record your video directly from their site.

3. Copy the link to your uploaded video and include it in your application under the Section titled "URL (to LinkedIn profile, portfolio, etc.)"
summary: Hiring for Fall Semester. This position deals with the organizing and assigning of remotely proctored exams to be proctored in a timely manner.

title: Video Engineering Tech
description:
We are looking for a student seeking practical experience while helping our team achieve our goals and objectives.

Must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Must be responsible, self-motivated, self-starter, personable, teachable and well organized. 
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. 
  • Must be able to effectively handle stressful situations.
  • Must be able lift at least 50 lbs.
  • Ability to work comfortably at heights.
  • Minimum of two semesters of school left
  • Ability to work nights and weekends.
  • Be able to creatively interpret ideas as well as follow directions.

Student must have experience in at least three (or more) of the following areas:

  • Ability to use and understand various kinds of test equipment, tools, and meters such as volt, ohm, and amp meters.
  • Interest and experience in entertainment production.
  • Experience Operating Scissor Lifts, Forklifts, boom lifts, etc.
  • Experience with computer network troubleshooting. 
  • Experience with electronics repair.
summary: We are looking for a student seeking practical experience while helping our team achieve our goals and objectives. We need a student with experience in a number of areas (explained below). They  must be able to demonstrate the following: • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. • Must be responsible, self-motivated, self-starter, personable, teachable and well organized.

title: PSYCHCourses OnlineTutor
description:
Online tutor that can help students in any of the following classes is needed: PSYCH 111, PSYCH 112, PSYCH 201, PSYCH 302, PSYCH 311, PSYCH 342, or PSYCH 350. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning). 

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah and must have received an A- or better in the classes. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

 Please indicate which PSYCH courses you can tutor, from the list above, on your application.Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process.

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595. 

Please provide your unofficial academic transcript from BYUI by attaching it to this application by doing the following:

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595. 

Please up-load your unofficial transcript to this application by following the steps below:

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.

approximateHoursPerWeek: 5-10 hours (must post 7 hours of appt openings and work 3+ hours on tutorin

title: GESCI101 OnlineTutor
description:
Online Tutor is needed for the GESCI 101. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning).  

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595. 

Please up-load your unofficial transcript to this application by following the steps below:

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.
summary: Tutor is needed for the GESCI 101: From Atoms to Humans class. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. The hours for this job vary, depending on tutor load each week. Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah.
approximateHoursPerWeek: 5-10 hours (must post 7 hours of appt openings and work 3+ hours on tutorin

Online Tutor is needed for CS 124 (CSE 111 or CSE 110): Introduction to Software Development. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning).  

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595. 

Please up-load your unofficial transcript to this application by following the steps below:

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.
summary: Online Tutor is needed for the CS 124 (CSE 111 or CSE 110). Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at 208-496-1595 or oas.employment@byui.edu.
approximateHoursPerWeek: 5-10 hours (must post 7 hours of appt openings and work 3+ hours on tutori
workSchedule: Flexible: Hours worked may vary according to student demand

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah and must have received an A- or better in the classes. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day.

title: BUS374 OnlineTutor
description:
Online Tutor is needed for the BUS 374 class. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning). 

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595.

description:

Monday through Friday from 8am to 11am.

Online Tutor is needed for the BUS 115 or BA 215. Help students succeed and choose your own weekly hours! The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning). 

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. title: Systems & Innovation: Product Specialist
description:
Responsibilities

  • Research educational technology platforms

  • Synthesize platform release notes

  • Provide expertise knowledge for the team

  • Maintain documentation for assigned platforms

Desired Skills (helpful, not required)

  • Deep researching abilities

  • Ability to write thorough instructions

  • Web applications

  • Detail-oriented

  • Life-long learner

  • Professionalism

We ask that you submit a resume and cover letter as part of the application process. You will also need to go through a technology skill test with the Academic Technology Center, which will be scheduled if you are selected to move forward. We provide on-the-job training and professional development as part of employment with the Systems and Innovation Team with Online Learning. The position requires at least 12 hours a week, but we provide flexible scheduling options to accommodate various school schedules.
summary: As a Product Specialist, you will be expected to become the expert in 3-5 educational technology platforms. You will be the touchpoint team member on specific products where you will provide knowledge support for product updates and ticket requests. As you learn about your product platforms, you will be expected to create and maintain documentation. You will ensure documentation, resources, assets, and processes are up-to-date for products under your stewardship.
workSchedule: Monday-Saturday (7 AM to 10 PM, flexible shifts)

title: IT Service Desk Analyst
description:
JOB DETAILS

Title: IT Service Desk Analyst

Posted: 4/29/2022

Job Summary:

The IT Service Desk acts as the single point of contact (SPOC) for the IT department. As such, we provide technical support for all IT services and products. This is accomplished by providing customer service through the phone, chat, walk-up, and email channels. Applicants must be able to demonstrate proficiency in technical problem-solving and customer service.

Job Description:

The Service Desk Analyst is an IT professional who assists in resolving or reporting incidents, fulfilling service requests, and ensuring accurate adherence to standardized Service Level Agreements (SLA’s). The Analyst accomplishes this by utilizing the training, tools, and knowledge provided by the IT department. This knowledge and training is enhanced by the Knowledge Centered Service model and is facilitated by the IT Knowledge Base and its curators, engineers, and other support personnel. All incidents and service requests are documented in our IT Service Management (ITSM) tool for trend identification, data analysis, appropriate incident escalation, service request routing, etc. The Analyst is tasked with balancing creative and technical problem-solving, customer service, and collaboration with other IT professionals at BYU-Idaho.

Requirements:

  • Experience in customer service
  • Technical trouble-shooting skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Basic computer skills (i.e., Microsoft Office, the ability to use a web browser, etc.)
  • Ability to use time productively, maximize efficiency, and meet challenging work goals
  • Exceptional analytical skills
  • Ability to work on-campus
  • 3 or more semesters remaining before graduation (required)
  • Adherence to BYUI and IT dress & grooming standards (see below)

DRESS AND GROOMING:

The Information Technology department requires business casual dress and strict adherence to the BYUI grooming standards (shaving exceptions are not recognized) for continued employment. As such, applicants are expected to meet these expectations throughout the entire interview process in order to be considered for employment.

SHIFTS:

Due to the unique nature of the job and consideration of office size constraints, we require all employees to align their work schedules according to a shift-based system, with employees selecting one shift that fits their schedule. All shifts are on a Mon-Fri schedule with optional Saturday shifts available, as well. Currently, we are hiring for Fall 2022 semester. Students who can work the last two weeks of Summer break for training will be preferred.

  • Team 1: 7:30-11am (17 hrs)
  • Team 2: 11-2pm (15 hrs) Available
  • Team 3: 2-5pm (15 hrs) Available
  • Team 4: 5-8pm (15 hrs)
  • Full-time: 8-5pm (40 hrs)

REQUIRED DOCUMENTS:

  • Resume
  • Cover Letter (addressed to IT Service Desk Hiring Committee)
  • Letter(s) of Recommendation (optional)

IMPORTANT:

We do not accept applications to this job board. Instead, we have an online hiring tool that allows us to perform digital interviews from pre-recorded video responses. Your digital interview may take up to 25 minutes to complete. So please prepare accordingly. As it is an official interview, please treat it as such, including wearing appropriate business attire. When you are ready to apply, please follow this link:

https://byuidaho.hirevue.com/signup/34VYUFw8Qn8ChNLZgCj4srR/ 

Applications submitted to this job board and not through the provided link will be d
summary: The Service Desk provides technical support to all BYU-Idaho end users. This is accomplished by providing customer service through the phone and chat system.

description: Carpet Cleaning in the campus housing unit as well as possibly carpet cleaning and custodial work around campus including restrooms and offices, operation of heavy and awkward equipment, walking and pushing carts, carrying supplies and tools, lifting up to 75 pounds is regularly required, working with chemicals, lifting hands above head, kneeling, walking, standing for the full shift. Other assignments as requested.
summary: Cleaning campus buildings. Shift is 7:30 pm-10:30 pm Monday-Friday and some Saturdays as required by the building assigned, approximately 15 hours weekly.

title: Mechanical Engineering Lab Coordinator
description:
-Must have a solid understanding in the field of Mechanical Engineering. 

-Must be available for at least 1 semester, 2 or more semesters is preferable.

-Preferably have leadership/management experience.

-Needs to have excelled in most of these courses...ME142, 172, 201, 202, 204, 250, 322.
summary: This position is responsible for helping with the organization and success of the Mechanical Engineering Drop-In Lab. This person must have great leadership abilities, effective communication skills, and excellent organizational abilities.

title: Teleprompter Operator
description:
This position is for Fall Semester, but preference will be given to those who can train during the summer.

Excellent command of English language, spelling and grammar. Excellent keyboard and computer skills. Familiarity with Microsoft Word. Well groomed and dressed. Able to work in close environment with others. Must have good hygiene.  Communication skills a must. Steady hand-eye coordination needed.  If we return to in person graduation, you must be available to work on graduation day each semester. A plus if you are an English major or minor.  Hopefully will have at least two years left in schooling.  Hiring for long term. Must have fun.
summary:
Please read whole description before applying.  Setting up, prepping, running and striking teleprompter for Devotional and other meetings and events. This is a slightly stressful work environment. Most work happens 
Tuesday between 8:30 a.m. and 12:30 p.m., so you must be available this time slot. There may be other events during the week that will need support.
Looking for Year Round.

title: MC Afternoon Custodian
description:
Job includes: cleaning restrooms, basic cleaning (dusting, wiping tables/chairs, sweeping, mopping, etc.), helping with event setup/take down, and other responsibilities as directed by supervisor.

Please be aware that the physical requirements of this job include:

  • Carpet cleaning
  • Custodial work including the cleaning of restrooms and offices
  • Operation of heavy and sometimes awkward equipment
  • Walking and pushing carts
  • Carrying supplies and tools
  • The ability to lift up to 50 pounds required
  • Working with chemicals
  • Lifting hands above head, kneeling, walking, and standing for a 3 hour shift
  • And other assignments as requested

title: Online Tutor - TESOL 102
description:
Online Tutor for TESOL 102: TESOL Pedagogy I is needed to help students become acquainted with many practical aspects of TESOL. The duties for this position include: posting 7 or more weekly hours in I-Plan, meeting with students over zoom, engaging daily in the student learning community (answer student questions, create learning resources, oversee peer-to-peer learning).  

Hiring Requirements: Applicants must be living in Idaho or Utah. Applicants must have taken the class and received an A- or better. Applicants must also have the following skills/attributes: time management, teaching, patience, goal setting, self motivation, and being active each day. 

If hired, applicants will complete a training that will teach them effective tutoring practices as well as how to use I-Plan, Zoom, and the Online Student Community. Our office may contact you by phone or text during the hiring process. For more information please contact the Online Academic Support Office at oas.employment@byui.edu or call 208-496-1595. 


Directions for downloading unofficial student transcripts

1. Sign into the BYUI website

2 On the left, there are some menus to choose from. Choose the "Academic Resources" menu.

3. There is a "more" arrow on this menu. Click on that.

4. Select "Records"

5. Then, click on "transcript request"

6. On the left click "view unofficial transcript"

7. Two arrows come down underneath this. Click on "pdf unofficial transcript".

8. Once you see your transcript, you can download it as a PDF file on your computer or usb drive.

9. Then upload this pdf file as one of the 3 attachments (resume, cover letter, transcript) on your application.

title: Fire Safety Student
description:
Qualified students’ responsibilities will include assisting in the inspection, testing, and maintenance of all fire suppression, and fire alarm systems on campus.  They will also be required to help perform fire watches for campus events.  Preference will be given to those students who have some training/experience in occupational safety.

To apply for this position, please do so in HireVue by following this link:

https://byuidaho.hirevue.com/signup/8aFK8U3puDFPa2MkPAZPdi/

HireVue is an online recording system where we will be able to have a better understanding of who you are. You will need device with camera and microphone.

Applications not done through HireVue will be ignored.
summary: Keeping campus and their occupants safe by helping everyone stay up to code. We help with all the NFPA, OSHA and Safety codes.

description:
Employees will assist with patrolling campus building, locking and securing all interior and exterior doors in campus buildings. Employees will also assist Campus patrol officers with event security and other security issues that occur on campus.

This job includes working evenings, weekends including Sunday.

title: Student Project Manager
description:
The student project manager position undertakes a series of different tasks in the media development section of Online Curriculum Development. Common duties include:

  • Day-to-day administrative tasks within the video department office.
  • Manage events and communication between clients, cast, crew, and producers.
  • Manage the pre-production and production elements required for filming, including props, locations, actors, special equipment, etc.
  • Manage delivery and storage of media assets. 
  • Maintain an active roll assisting in all aspects of audio, video, and film production. 

Ideal Candidate:

  • Business, Communication or related major desired.
  • On active track in the project management profession.
  • Substantial understanding and experience with common Microsoft and Google tools such as docs, spreadsheets, calendar, preferred.
  • Demonstrable writing, communication, and multi-tasking skills.
summary: Assist in managing the audiovisual section of Online Curriculum Development.

title: Hard Floor Team Member
description:
Duties include cleaning, buffing, re-surfacing, and finishing of the hard floors on campus, which includes vinyl tile, hardwood, and stone.

This position must be able to lift 50 lbs., bend, stand, and kneel for extended periods of time, and communicate effectively.

-The shift hours are: Monday-Friday, 8 PM-11 PM, with 15 hour weeks standard.
-Work occasionally on Saturday as needed for special assignments.

-Adjust hours occasionally as needed for special assignments.
summary: This team member will work under the direction of the team student coordinator and team supervisor, to care for and clean the hard surface floors on campus.

title: Male Art Model
description:
BEFORE APPLYING PLEASE READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS VERY CAREFULLY. FAILURE TO FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS COULD RESULT IN US NOT REVIEWING YOUR APPLICATION.

The Art Department hires students each semester to model for Art classes. We are interested in a variety of models with different hair styles, coloring, and body types. All models will be expected to model as both head AND figure models. If you are unwilling to work as a figure model for whatever reason, you will not be hired.

Head modeling: Art students will draw/paint/sculpt models from the shoulders up.

Figure modeling: Art students will draw/paint/sculpt the entire figure. Men wear compression bottoms. (Modeling Uniform is provided by the Art Department.)

Models must be dependable and punctual for scheduled time. Class cannot start without them! Models will be expected to sit very still in poses but will be given breaks every 25 minutes during the class time. We rotate models to give a variety of faces and figures for students to draw.

How to apply:

1. Review this list to see if you are available to model for AT LEAST THREE of the following class times:

MW 11:15 am- 2:30 pm 

MW 2:30 pm-5:45 pm

T/Th 8:00 am-11:15 am

T/Th 12:30 pm- 3:45 pm

T/Th 7:00 pm-10:00 pm

F 8:45 am-12:00 pm

F 9:45 am-1:00 pm

2. If you are available for AT LEAST THREE of the above class times, please email us at art_dept@byui.edu with subject line "Model Application." Include the following information:

a. Your first and last name

b. Your phone number

c. Your email (whichever you check most frequently)

d. The class time you are available to model for (DO NOT send us your student schedule.)

e. Have you worked as a model in the BYUI Art Department before? If so, when?

f. Attach a full body CLOTHED photo of yourself.

3. After we review the applications, you will receive an email informing you whether or not you were hired and be given additional instructions to complete the hiring process. This takes a couple weeks, and we are closed between semesters, so we ask you to please be patient. If hired, you will be notified about a mandatory meeting for all models. We will share more detailed information at this meeting the first week of the new semester.

Scheduling: We use many models for each class. Because art students need to experience a variety of models, you will be scheduled on a rotation through the classes you are available for (so they don't see the same head or figure each week). As such, you will NOT be working every shift you are available for- you'll be put in a scheduling rotation. Once the schedule is given to you, you will be expected to be at the scheduled class on time, dressed as needed, and ready to model. Failure to show up for your scheduled time will result in dismissal.

***Typically, models average between 3 and 6 hours a week.
summary: Head and Figure Model for Art Classes
approximateHoursPerWeek: varies

title: Chemistry Stockroom/TA/Grader
description:
This is a general application form for any open positions in the chemistry department for the upcoming semester. Tasks vary by position. Teaching Assistants help with labs, Graders grade labs, and Stockroom Assistants set up labs and prepare lab chemicals. Hours vary based on position. The number and type of positions are based on the labs offered by the department.

  • To be considered for any position, the applicant must have completed Chemistry 105. Preference will be given to students who received at least a B in the course

To obtain an application, download the spreadsheet linked below. Using Microsoft Excel, complete the spreadsheet to specify which positions you are interested in and to indicate your availability for work. Attach the completed Excel spreadsheet to your application as your resume, or email it to Brother Wood (woodmic@byui.edu).  

Application Spreadsheet

  • Incomplete applications or .pdf copies of the spreadsheet will not be considered

Remote TA positions have several additional requirements:

  • A stable internet connection
  • A computer with a Webcam
  • A willingness to engage students via Zoom for 2-3 hours per shift.
  • Must be living in the state of Utah or Idaho

Please contact Brother Wood with any questions regarding available positions or the application process.
summary: General Application form for all chemistry department positions. These positions include stockroom assistants(SA), teaching assistants(TA), and Graders. Certain positions may be hired for remote work.

title: Security-Lock up Patrol
description:
Employees will assist with patrolling campus building, locking and securing all interior and exterior doors in campus buildings. Employees will also assist Campus patrol officers with event security and other security issues that occur on campus.

This job includes working evenings, weekends including Sunday.

title: Music Production Team (Music Dept.)
description:
This position supports productions for the Department of Music. Ideal candidates will have the following:

  • Audio technician/recording/engineering and live sound experience and working knowledge (i.e. behavior/properties of sound, psychoacoustics, signal flow, gain staging, SFX, mic placement, polar patterns, monitoring, signal processors, editing/mixing).
  • DAW proficiency and experience, preferably Pro Tools
  • Basic video camera knowledge and operation skills
  • Basic stage skills and knowledge for supporting classical music ensembles (i.e. instrumentation within an orchestra, etc.)
  • Tues. - Fri. evenings after 5:30pm and all day Saturdays must be generally available to work a varied work schedule based upon event needs and times.
  • Good communication, organization, dependability, punctuality, interpersonal, and team skills
  • The ability to work well under tight deadlines and stressful situations
  • The ability to be proactive and take initiative to solve issues independently
  • The ability to remember and pay attention to production details that support the musical arts

Apply via HireVue at: https://byuidaho.hirevue.com/signup/VYX5bzUUgNvxAXYiaC8HCY/
summary: Audio, video, and stage production support for Department of Music events (choir, orchestra, band, jazz). See the Job Description for how to apply.
